topic.title: Block 3rd-party requests with uBlock Origin
topic.body:
### Here's how to block 3rd-party requests with **uBlock Origin**:

- Download & Install **uBlock Origin**
  - [Firefox](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/ublock-origin/)
  - [Chrome/Chromium](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/ublock-origin/cjpalhdlnbpafiamejdnhcphjbkeiagm?hl=es)
  - [Edge](https://www.microsoft.com/store/p/app/9nblggh444l4)
  - [Safari](https://github.com/el1t/uBlock-Safari)
  - [Opera](https://addons.opera.com/en-gb/extensions/details/ublock/)
- Go to the **Dashboard**:
  - By visiting `chrome://ublock0/content/dashboard.html#settings.html`
  - Or click on the **red shield icon** in your toolbar and then click on the **configuration wheel icon** in the popup.
- Select `I am an advanced user`
- Go back to any ZeroNet page
- Click on the  **red shield icon** and make the **2nd column** of `3rd-party` **red**
  - Or if you want to block `3rd-party` requests **everywhere** make the **1st column** **red**
- If you want to whitelist a domain on the current domain make the **2nd column** **green**
  - Or if you want to whitelist a domain **everywhere**  make the **1st column** **green**

### Github Repositories:
https://github.com/gorhill/uBlock **[Official]**
https://github.com/nikrolls/uBlock-Edge
https://github.com/el1t/uBlock-Safari

###KIWIX - THE OFFLINE INTERNET - 离线互联网

You can get offline ZIM files for /// 获取离线 ZIM 文件:
- **stack_exchange (All sites including StackOverflow /// 所有网站, 包括 StackOverflow)**
- wikipedia (Encyclopedia /// 百科全书)
- wikibooks (Community Books /// 社区书籍)

- Then choose `File` > `Open file ...` /// 选择 `文件` > `打开文件 ...`
- Choose `.zim` file /// 选择  `.zim` 文件

3_156xbcM9BrbdhtYZUPAQBFvLDGGyy5AjdM.body:
+1
I believe this is necessary for decentralized application development. For example, I want to create a few Zites, each of them can be used for a month (or a year, whatever), so that the Zites are better manageable, and older Zites  can be archived automatically.

Let me clarify again why this is necessary:
For example: to prevent a Zite from getting too big I create a few sites in advance:
* `Zite A` with a `unfreeze_period` of `["2017-01-01", "2017-03-01"]` 
* `Zite B` with a `unfreeze_period` of `["2017-03-01", "2017-06-01"]` 
* `Zite C` with a `unfreeze_period` of `["2017-06-01", "2017-09-01"]` 
So every Zite is automatically "unfrozen" for user contributed content for roughly 2 months, after that the Zite is "frozen" automatically again.
If a Zite is not open for user contributed content the peers that serve the Zite won't allow any user to submit or change user contributed content, though the `content.json` can still be changed by the Zite owner.

Also with "freeze" I don't mean "pause" because the Zite should still be served by peers.

ZeroTier is a Virtual Private Network (VPN). Sadly it doesn't support Forward Secrecy (ephemeral public key encryption). 
So if your private key gets stolen all previously stored encrypted data can be decrypted.
Check out [Tinc VPN](http://tinc-vpn.org/) which does have Forward Secrecy.
